Chapter on the Aggregates, Section on Questions, Chapter 1 on the Aggregates, Question:
How many sense bases are there?
Answer:
Twelve.
What are the twelve?
The six internal sense bases and the six external sense bases.
What are the six internal sense bases?
The eye sense base, ear sense base, nose sense base, tongue sense base, body sense base, and mind sense base, these are called the six internal sense bases.
What are the six external sense bases?
The form sense base, sound sense base, smell sense base, taste sense base, touch sense base, and dharma sense base, these are called the six external sense bases.
Thus, the six internal sense bases and the six external sense bases are called the twelve sense bases.
What is the eye sense base?
The eye faculty is called the eye sense base.
What is the eye sense base?
The eye element is called the eye sense base.
What is the eye sense base?
If the eye is included in the self, and is composed of the four great elements and derivative form of the past, future, and present, it is called the eye sense base.
What is the eye sense base?
If the eye is included in the self, and is composed of the four great elements and derivative form of the past, future, and present, it is called the eye sense base.
What is the eye sense base?

If the eye is included in the self, and is not definite as to whether it has already seen, is now seeing, or will see form, or if the eye is included in the self, and is not definite as to whether the light of form has already come, is now coming, or will come, it is called the eye sense base.
What is the eye sense base?

If the eye is included in the self, and is not definite as to whether form has already come into contact with the eye, is now coming into contact, or will come into contact, or if the eye is unobstructed, it is the eye sense base, the eye faculty, the eye element, the field, the substance, the door, the storehouse, the world, the pure [element], the spring, the ocean, the salt-encrusted [land], the whirlpool, the wound, the bond, the eye, the included part of the self, this shore, the internal sense base.
The eye seeing form is called the eye sense base. The ear, nose, tongue, and body sense bases are also like this.
What is the mind-faculty sense-sphere?
The mind-faculty is called the mind-faculty sense-sphere.
What is the mind-faculty sense-sphere?
The consciousness aggregate is called the mind-faculty sense-sphere.
What is the mind-faculty sense-sphere?
The mind, thought, cognition, the six groups of consciousness, and the seven groups of consciousness are called the mind-faculty sense-sphere.
What is the mind-faculty sense-sphere?
If consciousness is past, future, or present, internal or external, gross or subtle, inferior or superior, far or near, it is called the mind-faculty sense-sphere.
What are the six groups of consciousness?
The eye-consciousness group, ear, nose, tongue, body, and mind-consciousness groups.
What is the eye-consciousness group?

Dependent on the eye, dependent on form, dependent on light, dependent on mental attention, with these four conditions arises consciousness, already arisen, now arisen, or to be arisen, indeterminate, this is called the eye-consciousness group.
What is the ear, nose, tongue, body, and mind-consciousness group?

Dependent on the mind, dependent on phenomena, dependent on mental attention, with these three conditions consciousness has already arisen, now arises, or will arise, indeterminate, this is called the mind-consciousness group.
This is called the six groups of consciousness.
What are the seven groups of consciousness?
The eye-consciousness element, ear, nose, tongue, body consciousness elements, and the mind element and mind-consciousness element.
What is the eye-consciousness element?
If consciousness arises from the eye faculty and form objects, already arisen, now arisen, or to be arisen, but not fixed, this is called the eye-consciousness element.
What is the ear, nose, tongue, and body consciousness elements?
If consciousness arises from the body faculty and the dominant contact objects, already arisen, now arisen, or to be arisen, but not fixed, this is called the body consciousness element.
What is the mind element?
The mind knowing and recollecting phenomena, if the initial thought is already arisen, now arisen, or to be arisen, but not fixed, this is called the mind element.
What is the mind-consciousness element?
If consciousness is similar, not apart from those objects and other similar thoughts, already arisen, now arisen, or to be arisen, but not fixed, this is called the mind-consciousness element.
These are called the seven consciousness elements.
What is past consciousness?
If consciousness has already ceased, this is called past consciousness.
What is future consciousness?
If consciousness has not yet arisen or emerged, this is called future consciousness.
What is present consciousness?
If the mind has arisen but not yet ceased, it is called present consciousness.
What is internal consciousness?
If consciousness is experienced, it is called internal consciousness.
What is external consciousness?
If consciousness is not experienced, it is called external consciousness.
What is coarse consciousness?
If consciousness is bound to the desire realm, it is called coarse consciousness.
What is subtle consciousness?
If consciousness is bound to the form realm, the formless realm, or is unbound, it is called subtle consciousness.
What is inferior consciousness?
If consciousness is unwholesome, the result of unwholesome dharmas, or if consciousness is neither the result nor the cause of pleasant dharmas, it is called inferior consciousness.
What is superior consciousness?
If consciousness is wholesome, the result of wholesome dharmas, or if consciousness is neither the result nor the cause of pleasant dharmas, it is called superior consciousness.
What is distant consciousness?
If consciousnesses are far apart, extremely far apart, not near, not on the edge, it is called distant consciousness.
What is near consciousness?
If the characteristics of various consciousnesses are close, extremely close, or bordering on close, this is called close consciousness.
What is the sense base of form?
The form realm is called the sense base of form.
What is the sense base of form?
The characteristics of form that accompany it are called the sense base of form.
What is the sense base of form?
If form is visible and resistant, and cognizable by eye consciousness, this is called the sense base of form.
What is the sense base of form?

If the sense base of form is produced by karma, afflictions, and retribution, and belongs to one's own aggregates, such as good form, bad form, beautiful, ugly, smooth, rough, pure, impure, or bodily actions such as going, coming, bending, stretching, and turning produced by wholesome, unwholesome, or neutral minds, or external forms cognizable by eye consciousness such as blue, yellow, red, white, black, purple, coarse, fine, long, short, square, round, water, land, light, shadow, smoke, clouds, dust, mist, vapor, light, darkness, and other external forms cognizable by eye consciousness, this is called the sense base of form.
What is the sense base of sound?
The sound element is called the sound sense base.
What is the sound sense base?
If form is invisible and resistant, cognized by the ear consciousness, it is called the sound sense base.
What is the sound sense base?

If the sound sense base is produced by karma and afflictions, belongs to the category of retribution, is a good sound or bad sound, a subtle sound or not subtle sound, a soft sound or not soft sound, arises from a wholesome, unwholesome, or indeterminate mind, is the collection of sounds, words, and phrases, oral instructions, or external sounds cognized by the ear consciousness such as the sound of a conch, a large drum, a small drum, a string instrument, a flute, cymbals, dancing, singing, music, crying, male voice, female voice, human voice, non-human voice, the voice of sentient beings, the voice of non-sentient beings, the sound of going, the sound of coming, the sound of contact, the sound of wind, rain, and water, the sound of the mutual contact of the great elements, and other external sounds cognized by the ear consciousness, this is called the sound sense base.ğŸ”½What is the smell sense base?
The smell element is called the smell sense base.
What is the sense-field of smells?
If form is invisible and resistant, and is cognized by the nose-consciousness, this is called the sense-field of smells.
What is the sense-field of smells?

If the sense-field of smells is produced by karma, dharmas, and afflictions, and is included in the category of retribution, the good smells, bad smells, soft smells, not soft smells, pleasant smells, and unpleasant smells of the body, if the external smells cognized by the nose-consciousness, the smells of tree roots, tree hearts, tree resins, tree barks, flowers, leaves, fruits, good smells, bad smells, and other external smells cognized by the nose-consciousness, this is called the sense-field of smells.
What is the sense-field of tastes?
The taste element is called the sense-field of tastes.
What is the sense-field of tastes?
If form is invisible and resistant, and is cognized by the tongue-consciousness, this is called the sense-field of tastes.
What is the sense-field of tastes?ğŸ”½Here is the corrected and aligned text:

If the taste element is born from karmic dharmas and afflictions, and belongs to the category of retribution, it is the sweet, sour, bitter, pungent, salty, or bland saliva in the body. If it is an external taste cognized by the tongue consciousness, such as sweet, sour, bitter, pungent, salty, or bland water, and other external tastes cognized by the tongue consciousness, this is called the taste element.
What is the touch element?
The touch element is called the touch element.
What is the touch element?
If form is invisible and resistant, and cognized by the body consciousness, this is called the touch element.
What is the touch element?

If the touch element is born from karmic dharmas and afflictions, and belongs to the category of retribution, it is the cold, hot, light, heavy, rough, smooth, hard, or soft in the body. If it is an external touch cognized by the body consciousness, such as cold, hot, light, heavy, rough, smooth, hard, or soft, and other external touches cognized by the body consciousness, this is called the touch element.
What is the dharma element?
The dharma element is called the dharma element.
What is the dharma element?ğŸ”½Here is the corrected and aligned text:
The aggregates of feeling, perception, and mental formations, as well as form that is invisible and unimpeded, or unconditioned, are called the dharma element.
What is the dharma element?
Feeling, perception, intention, contact, thought, applied thought, sustained thought, view, wisdom, liberation,
absence of greed, absence of hatred, absence of delusion, faith, remorse, non-remorse, joy,
exertion of mind, purification of mind, faith, desire, heedfulness, mindfulness, concentration,
equanimity of mind, doubt, fear, defilements, birth, aging, death, life, bonds,

unrestricted access concentration, attainment of fruit, attainment of cessation, bodily and verbal non-virtuous non-intimation, bodily and verbal virtuous non-intimation with outflows, bodily exertion with outflows, bodily purification with outflows, right speech, right action, right livelihood,
right bodily exertion, right bodily purification, destruction of contaminants by wisdom, destruction of contaminants not by wisdom, abiding in the determined state,
wisdom of the sphere of infinite space, wisdom of the sphere of infinite consciousness, wisdom of the sphere of nothingness, wisdom of the sphere of neither-perception-nor-non-perception,
The cognition of these is called the dharma-Äyatana.
Among the twelve Äyatanas, how many are form and how many are not form?
Ten are form, one is not form, and two are partly form and partly not form.
What are the ten that are form?
The eye Äyatana, ear, nose, tongue, and body Äyatanas, the form Äyatana, sound, smell, taste, and touch Äyatanas - these are called the ten that are form.
What is the one that is not form?
The mind Äyatana - this is called the one that is not form.
What are the two that are partly form and partly not form?
The dharma Äyatana - this is called the two that are partly form and partly not form.
What is the form part of the dharma Äyatana?

Bodily and verbal non-virtuous non-manifest karma, tainted bodily and verbal virtuous non-manifest karma, tainted bodily vigor, tainted bodily seclusion, right speech, right action, right livelihood, right bodily vigor, and right bodily seclusion - this is called the form part of the dharma Äyatana.
What is the non-form part of the dharma Äyatana?

Feeling, perception, up to the concentration of cessation, the extinction resulting from the discrimination of the object and the subject, up to the cognition of the sphere of neither-perception-nor-non-perception - this is called the non-form part of the dharma Äyatana.
Among the twelve sense bases, how many are visible and how many are invisible?
One is visible, eleven are invisible.
What is the one that is visible?
The sense base of form is called the one that is visible.
What are the eleven that are invisible?
The nine sense bases of form, the sense base of mind, and the sense base of mental objects are called the eleven that are invisible.
Among the twelve sense bases, how many are resistant and how many are non-resistant?
Ten are resistant, two are non-resistant.
What are the ten that are resistant?
The ten sense bases of form are called the ten that are resistant.
What are the two that are non-resistant?
The sense base of mind and the sense base of mental objects are called the two that are non-resistant.
Among the twelve sense bases, how many are noble and how many are not noble?
Ten are not noble, two are twofold, either noble or not noble.
What are the ten that are not noble?
The ten sense bases of form are called the ten that are not noble.
What are the two that are twofold, either noble or not noble?
The mind-base and the dharma-base are called the two bases that are either noble or not noble.
What is the mind-base that is not noble?
If the mind-base is contaminated, it is called the mind-base that is not noble.
What is the mind-base that is not noble?
If the mind-consciousness aggregate is associated with the mind-base, it is called the mind-base that is not noble.
What is the mind-base that is not noble?
If the mind-base is neither learner nor post-learner, such as eye-consciousness up to mind-consciousness, it is called the mind-base that is not noble.
What is the mind-base that is noble?
If the mind-base is uncontaminated, it is called the mind-base that is noble.
What is the mind-base that is noble?
If the mind-base is associated with the faculty of faith, such as the mind element and mind-consciousness element, it is called the mind-base that is noble.
What is the mind-base that is noble?

If the mind-base is learner or post-learner, a learner person who has eliminated the fetters, the noble mind enters the noble path, such as one of firm faith, one of firm Dharma, and others who see the faults of saá¹ƒsÄra, contemplate nirvÄá¹‡a as tranquil.

Contemplating the truth of suffering, its origin, its cessation, and the path, one wishes to attain what has not been attained, to understand what has not been understood, and to realize what has not been realized, and cultivates the path to eliminate afflictions.

If a learner, such as a stream-enterer, once-returner, or non-returner, fully possesses the wisdom and insight, whether it be the stage of wisdom or the liberation of insight, they will then realize the fruits of the Å›ramaá¹‡a, such as the fruit of stream-entry, the fruit of once-returning, or the fruit of non-returning.

If a post-learner wishes to attain the fruit of arhatship, and has not yet attained the noble dharmas, wishing to attain them, fully possessing the wisdom and insight, whether it be the stage of wisdom or the liberation of insight, they will then realize the fruit of arhatship.
Whether it be a real person, a realm, the element of mind, or the element of mental consciousness, this is called the noble mental faculty.
What is the element of mental objects that is not noble?
If the element of mental objects is contaminated, this is called the element of mental objects that is not noble.
What is the element of mental objects that is not noble?

The aggregates of feeling, perception, and mental formations, form that is invisible and unimpeded and contaminated, and the unconditioned that is not noble - this is called the dharma element that is not noble.
What is the dharma element that is not noble?
The dharma element that is neither learner nor post-learner, feeling, perception, up to the attainment of the cessation of perception and feeling.
The first four formless [absorptions] are not noble, and the seven unconditioned [dharmas] - this is called the dharma element that is not noble.
What is the dharma element that is noble?
If the dharma element is pure, this is called the dharma element that is noble.
What is the dharma element that is noble?
If the faculty of faith, the mental factors associated with the faculty of faith, and the dharmas without object that are pure - this is called the dharma element that is noble.
What is the dharma element that is noble?
If the dharma element is of learners and post-learners.

Learners who have eliminated the defilements, with the holy mind entering the holy path, whether of firm faith, firm Dharma, or others, see the faults of saá¹ƒsÄra, contemplate nirvÄá¹‡a as quiescent extinction, contemplate suffering, its arising, its cessation, and the path as they really are, and wish to attain what has not been attained, to understand what has not been understood, and to realize what has not been realized, and cultivate the path to be free from afflictions.

Learners, whether stream-enterers, once-returners, or non-returners, with complete contemplation and wisdom, whether in the stage of wisdom or in the liberation of contemplation, immediately realize the fruits of the Å›ramaá¹‡a, whether the fruit of stream-entry, the fruit of once-returning, or the fruit of non-returning.

Non-learners who wish to attain arhatship, who wish to attain the holy Dharma that has not yet been attained, with complete contemplation and wisdom, whether in the stage of wisdom or in the liberation of contemplation, immediately realize the fruit of arhatship.

If it is a real person, a realm, or feeling, perception, intention, contact, thought, reflection, view, wisdom, liberation, non-delusion, faith, joy, mental exertion, mental purification, faith, desire, heedfulness, mindfulness, concentration, equanimity, attainment of fruits, attainment of cessation, right speech, right action, right livelihood, right effort, and right purification of mind and body, and knowledge of the exhaustion of taints and determination, these are called the holy aspects of the element of mental objects.
Among the twelve sense bases, how many are contaminated and how many are uncontaminated?
Ten are contaminated, two are twofold, either contaminated or uncontaminated.
What are the ten that are contaminated?
The ten material sense bases are called the ten that are contaminated.
What are the two that are twofold, either contaminated or uncontaminated?
The sense base of mind and the sense base of mental objects are called the two that are twofold, either contaminated or uncontaminated.
What is the sense base of mind that is contaminated?
If the sense base of mind has craving, it is called the sense base of mind that is contaminated.
What is the sense base of mind that is uncontaminated?
The consciousness aggregate is called the mental faculty sense base with contaminants.
What is the mental faculty sense base with contaminants?
The mental faculty sense base that is neither training nor post-training, eye consciousness up to mind consciousness, is called the mental faculty sense base with contaminants.
What is the mental faculty sense base without contaminants?
If the mental faculty sense base is without craving, it is called the mental faculty sense base without contaminants.
What is the mental faculty sense base without contaminants?
If the mental faculty sense base is associated with the faculty of faith, the mind element and the mind consciousness element, it is called the mental faculty sense base without contaminants.
What is the mental faculty sense base without contaminants?
If the mental faculty sense base is training or post-training, a trainee who is free from the bonds up to directly realizing the fruit of arhatship,
if it is a real person, a destination, the mind element and the mind consciousness element, it is called the mental faculty sense base without contaminants.
What is the dharma sense base with contaminants?
If the dharma sense base has craving, it is called the dharma sense base with contaminants.
What is the dharma sense base with contaminants?
The aggregates of feeling, perception, and mental formations, and form that is invisible and unimpeded with attachment, are called the element of mental objects with outflows.
What is the element of mental objects with outflows?

If the element of mental objects is neither training nor without training, the feelings, perceptions, up to the attainment of the cessation of perception and feeling, and the first four formless [absorptions], these are called the element of mental objects with outflows.
What is the element of mental objects without outflows?
If the element of mental objects is without attachment, it is called the element of mental objects without outflows.
What is the element of mental objects without outflows?
If the faculty of faith, the mental factors associated with the faculty of faith, the mental factors without object or attachment, these are called the element of mental objects without outflows.
What is the element of mental objects without outflows?
If the element of mental objects is training, without training, or unconditioned, a person in training is free from the bonds, up to immediately realizing the fruit of arhatship.

If it is a real person, a realm, or feeling, perception, intention, contact, thought, reflection, view, wisdom, liberation, non-delusion, faith-following, joy, mental exertion, mental purification, faith, desire, heedfulness, mindfulness, concentration, equanimity, attainment of fruits, attainment of cessation, right speech, right action, right livelihood, right effort, right purification of body, destruction of contaminants by knowledge, destruction of contaminants not by knowledge, determined dharmas, abiding in conditions, knowledge of the sphere of infinite space, knowledge of the sphere of infinite consciousness, knowledge of the sphere of nothingness, knowledge of the sphere of neither-perception-nor-non-perception, this is called the element of dharmas that is pure.
With craving, without craving, with seeking, without seeking, to be grasped, not to be grasped, with grasping, without grasping, with superiority, without superiority, it is the same.
Among the twelve sense bases, how many are feeling and how many are not feeling?
Five are feeling, seven are twofold, either feeling or not feeling.
What are the five that are feeling?
The sense bases of eye, ear, nose, tongue, and body are called the five that are feeling.
How are seven [sense bases] twofold, either with feeling or without feeling?
The sense bases of form, sound, smell, taste, touch, mind, and mental objects are called the seven twofold, either with feeling or without feeling.
How is the sense base of form with feeling?
If the sense base of form is internal, it is called the sense base of form with feeling.
How is the sense base of form with feeling?

If the sense base of form is produced by karma and afflictions, is a retribution, and is included in one's own body, such as good color, bad color, beautiful, not beautiful, smooth, not smooth, pure, not pure, or bodily action produced by feeling, such as going, coming, bending, stretching, and turning, it is called the sense base of form with feeling.
How is the sense base of form without feeling?
If the sense base of form is external, it is called the sense base of form without feeling.
How is the sense base of form without feeling?ğŸ”½Here is the corrected and aligned text:

If the form element is wholesome, unwholesome, or indeterminate, not included in my category, if it is produced by a wholesome mind, an unwholesome mind, a mind that is neither a ripening nor a dharma of ripening, if it is going, coming, bending, stretching, turning, or if it is external form cognized by the eye consciousness, this is called the form element that is not feeling.
What is the sound element that is feeling?
If the sound element is an internal sound element, this is called the sound element that is feeling.
What is the sound element that is feeling?

If the sound element is produced by karma and afflictions, if it is a ripening included in my category, if it is a good sound or not a good sound, a subtle sound or not a subtle sound, a soft sound or not a soft sound, if it is produced by a mind that is feeling, if it is the collection of sounds, words, phrases, and oral instructions, this is called the sound element that is feeling.
What is the sound element that is not feeling?
If the sound element is external,
this is called the sound element that is not feeling.
What is the sound element that is not feeling?

If the sound element is wholesome, unwholesome, or indeterminate, and not included in my category, if it is produced by a wholesome mind, an unwholesome mind, a mind that is neither a ripened nor a ripening factor, and the sound, words, phrases, and speech that are uttered, or if it is an external sound cognized by the ear consciousness, this is called the sound element that is not experienced.
What is the olfactory element that is experienced?
If the olfactory element is an internal olfactory element, this is called the olfactory element that is experienced.
What is the olfactory element that is not experienced?

If the olfactory element is produced by karma and afflictions, is a ripened result included in my category, and is a good smell, a bad smell, a soft smell, a harsh smell, a pleasant smell, or an unpleasant smell in the body, this is called the olfactory element that is experienced.
What is the olfactory element that is not experienced?

If the olfactory element is external, if it is an external smell cognized by the nose consciousness, the smell of tree roots, the smell of tree trunks, the smell of tree sap, the smell of tree bark, the smell of leaves, the smell of flowers, the smell of fruits, the smell of good things, the smell of bad things, and other external smells cognized by the nose consciousness, this is called the olfactory element that is not experienced.
What is the gustatory element that is experienced?
If the taste faculty is internal, it is called the taste faculty that is a sense base.
What is the taste faculty that is a sense base?

If the taste faculty is produced by the dharmas of karma and afflictions, and is included in the body as a retribution, such as sweet, sour, bitter, pungent, salty, bland, saliva, and phlegm, it is called the taste faculty that is a sense base.
What is the taste faculty that is not a sense base?

If the taste faculty is external, or if external tastes are known by the tongue consciousness, such as sweet, sour, bitter, pungent, salty, bland, water, juice, and other external tastes known by the tongue consciousness, it is called the taste faculty that is not a sense base.
What is the touch faculty that is a sense base?
If the touch faculty is internal, it is called the touch faculty that is a sense base.
What is the touch faculty that is a sense base?

If the touch faculty is produced by the dharmas of karma and afflictions, and is included in the body as a retribution, such as cold, heat, lightness, heaviness, roughness, smoothness, hardness, and softness, it is called the touch faculty that is a sense base.
What is the touch faculty that is not a sense base?

If external contact enters the body and is known by the body consciousness, whether cold or hot, light or heavy, rough or smooth, hard or soft, or other external contacts known by the body consciousness, this is called the contact base but not feeling.
What is the mind base that is feeling?
If the mind base is internal, it is called the mind base that is feeling.
What is the mind base that is feeling?

If the mind base is produced by karma, dharmas, and afflictions, and is included in the category of retribution and self, such as eye consciousness up to mind consciousness, this is called the mind base that is feeling.
What is the mind base that is not feeling?
If the mind base is external, it is called the mind base that is not feeling.
What is the mind base that is not feeling?

If the mind base is wholesome, unwholesome, indeterminate, and not included in the category of self, such as eye consciousness up to mind consciousness, this is called the mind base that is not feeling.
What is the dharma base that is feeling?
If the dharma base is internal, it is called the dharma base that is feeling.
What is the dharma base that is feeling?

If the factors included in the element of factors are produced by karma and afflictions, and are included in the category of retribution, the aggregates of feeling, perception, volition, contact, applied thought, sustained thought, view, wisdom, liberation, remorse, non-remorse, joy, delight, mental exertion, faith, desire, mindfulness, fear, life, and defiled exertion included in the element of factors, are called feeling included in the element of factors.
What is the element of factors that is not feeling?
If the element of factors is external, it is called the element of factors that is not feeling.
What is the element of factors that is not feeling?

If the element of factors is wholesome, unwholesome, indeterminate, and not included in the category of self, and the rest of the element of factors except for life, it is called the element of factors that is not feeling.
The internal and external are also like this.
How many of the twelve sense bases have retribution, and how many do not have retribution?
Eight do not have retribution, four are in two parts, either having retribution or not having retribution.
What are the eight that do not have retribution?

The sense base of the eye, the sense base of the ear, the sense base of the nose, the sense base of the tongue, the sense base of the body, the sense base of smell, the sense base of taste, and the sense base of touch, these are called the eight that do not have retribution.
How are the four two-fold as having retribution or not having retribution?
The form sense-sphere, sound sense-sphere, mind sense-sphere, and dharma sense-sphere are called the four two-fold as having retribution or not having retribution.
How is the form sense-sphere with retribution?
If the form sense-sphere is a dharma with retribution, it is called the form sense-sphere with retribution.
How is the form sense-sphere with retribution?
If the form sense-sphere is produced by wholesome or unwholesome thoughts, and the going, coming, bending, stretching, and turning of the body, it is called the form sense-sphere with retribution.
How is the form sense-sphere without retribution?

If the form sense-sphere is retribution, or if the form sense-sphere is not retribution, but the good color, bad color, beauty, ugliness, smoothness, roughness, purity, and impurity of the body, which are produced by indeterminate thoughts, the going, coming, bending, stretching, and turning, or the external form cognized by the eye-consciousness, it is called the form sense-sphere without retribution.
How is the sound sense-sphere with retribution?
If the sound sense-sphere is a dharma with retribution, it is called the sound sense-sphere with retribution.
How is the sound sense base subject to karmic recompense?

The sound sense base, whether wholesome or unwholesome, arises from wholesome or unwholesome minds, and is the sound, language, speech, and oral instructions that are produced. This is called the sound sense base subject to karmic recompense.
How is the sound sense base not subject to karmic recompense?
If the sound sense base is subject to karmic recompense,

if the sound sense base is not subject to karmic recompense, it is not a dharmas subject to karmic recompense, and is the pleasant or unpleasant sounds, the refined or unrefined sounds, the soft or harsh sounds, or the sound, language, speech, and oral instructions produced by indeterminate minds, or the external sounds cognized by the ear consciousness. This is called the sound sense base not subject to karmic recompense.
How is the mind sense base subject to karmic recompense?
If the mind sense base is a dharma subject to karmic recompense, it is called the mind sense base subject to karmic recompense.
How is the mind sense base not subject to karmic recompense?

Except for the wholesome karmic recompense of the mind sense base, the rest of the wholesome and unwholesome mind element and mind consciousness element are called the mind sense base subject to karmic recompense.
How is the mind sense base not subject to karmic recompense?
If the mind-faculty is a result, or if the mind-faculty is not a result, but not a result-producing dharma, eye-consciousness up to mind-consciousness, this is called the mind-faculty without result.
What is the element of mental objects with result?
If the element of mental objects is a result-producing dharma, this is called the element of mental objects with result.
What is the element of mental objects with result?

Except for the element of mental objects that is a good result, the other element of mental objects that is good and conditioned, if unwholesome, the volitions and perceptions up to the defilements, bonds, and fetters, the two concentrations, and all form, this is called the element of mental objects with result.
What is the element of mental objects without result?

If the element of mental objects is a result-producing dharma, but not a result, except for the absence of greed, absence of hatred, absence of delusion, defilements, bonds, and fetters, bodily and verbal non-virtuous non-intimation, the other element of mental objects is without result.
How many of the twelve sense bases are mind, and how many are not mind?
One is mind, eleven are not mind.
What is the one that is mind?
The mind sense base, this is called the one that is mind.
What are the eleven that are not mind?
Excluding the mind faculty, the remaining ones are not mind. These are called the eleven that are not mind.
Among the twelve sense bases, how many are associated with mind and how many are not associated with mind?
Ten are not associated with mind, one is not explained as either associated with mind or not associated with mind, and one part is either associated with mind or not associated with mind.
What are the ten that are not associated with mind?
The ten sense bases of form are called the ten that are not associated with mind.
What is the one that is not explained as either associated with mind or not associated with mind?
The mind sense base is called the one that is not explained as either associated with mind or not associated with mind.
What is the one part that is either associated with mind or not associated with mind?
The sense base of mental objects is called the one part that is either associated with mind or not associated with mind.
What is the sense base of mental objects that is associated with mind?
If the sense base of mental objects is a mental factor, feeling, perception, up to the defilements and latent tendencies, it is called the sense base of mental objects that is associated with mind.
What is the sense base of mental objects that is not associated with mind?
If the dharma element is not produced by the mind, up to the cognition of the base of neither-perception-nor-non-perception, it is called the dharma element not associated with the mind.
How many of the twelve sense bases are mental factors and how many are not mental factors?
Eleven are not mental factors, and one is twofold, either mental factors or not mental factors.
Why are eleven not mental factors?
The ten sense bases of form and the sense base of mind are called the eleven that are not mental factors.
Why is one twofold, either mental factors or not mental factors?
The dharma sense base is called one that is twofold, either mental factors or not mental factors.
What is the dharma sense base that is a mental factor?
If the dharma sense base has a support, feeling, perception, up to the latent afflictions, it is called the dharma sense base that is a mental factor.
What is the dharma sense base that is not a mental factor?

If the dharma sense base is without a support, the formless attainments, up to the cognition of the base of neither-perception-nor-non-perception, it is called the dharma sense base that is not a mental factor.
How many of the twelve sense bases are conditions and how many are not conditions?
One is a condition, ten are not conditions, and one is twofold, either a condition or not a condition.
What is the one that is a condition?
The mind-base, this is called the one that is a condition.
What are the ten that are not conditions?
The ten form-bases, these are called the ten that are not conditions.
What is the one that is twofold, either a condition or not a condition?
The dharma-base, this is called the one that is twofold, either a condition or not a condition.
What is the dharma-base that is a condition?
If the dharma-base is a mental factor, feeling, perception, up to the defilements and latent tendencies, this is called the dharma-base that is a condition.
What is the dharma-base that is not a condition?
If the dharma-base is not a mental factor, up to the cognition of the base of neither-perception-nor-non-perception, this is called the dharma-base that is not a condition.
Among the twelve bases, how many are associated with the mind and how many are not associated with the mind?
Eleven are not associated with the mind, and one is twofold, either associated with the mind or not associated with the mind.
What are the eleven that are not associated with the mind?
The ten form-bases and the mind-base, these are called the eleven that are not associated with the mind.
How are one and two parts either associated with the mind or not associated with the mind?
The dharma element is called one and two parts either associated with the mind or not associated with the mind.
What is the dharma element associated with the mind?

If the dharma element follows the mind, arises together with the mind, abides together with the mind, and ceases together with the mind, such as feeling, perception, afflictive tendencies, inoperative bodily and verbal restraint with outflows, bodily vigor with outflows, bodily exertion with outflows, right speech, right action, right livelihood, right effort, and right exertion, this is called the dharma element associated with the mind.
What is the dharma element not associated with the mind?

If the dharma element does not follow the mind, does not arise together with the mind, does not abide together with the mind, does not cease together with the mind, up to the cognition of the base of neither-perception-nor-non-perception, this is called the dharma element not associated with the mind.
Following the mind and not following the mind are also like this.
How many of the twelve sense bases are karmic and how many are not karmic?
Nine are not karmic, three are two parts, either karmic or not karmic.
What are the nine that are not karmic?

The eye sense-field, ear sense-field, nose sense-field, tongue sense-field, body sense-field, and mind sense-field, the smell sense-field, taste sense-field, and touch sense-field, these are called the nine that are not karma.
What are the three that are partly karma and partly not karma?
The form sense-field, sound sense-field, and dharma sense-field, these are called the three that are partly karma and partly not karma.
What is the form sense-field that is karma?
If it is the going, coming, bending, stretching, and bodily activity produced by a wholesome, unwholesome, or indeterminate mind, this is called the form sense-field that is karma.
What is the form sense-field that is not karma?

The good form, bad form, beautiful, not beautiful, smooth, not smooth, pure, and impure form of the body, and the external form cognized by the eye-consciousness, this is called the form sense-field that is not karma.
What is the sound sense-field that is karma?
If it is the sound, voice, speech, and verbal activity produced by a wholesome, unwholesome, or indeterminate mind,
this is called the sound sense-field that is karma.
What is the sound sense-field that is not karma?

If it is a pleasant sound or an unpleasant sound, a subtle sound or a coarse sound, a soft sound or a harsh sound, or if it is an external sound cognized by the ear consciousness, it is called the sound element that is not karma.
What is the dharma element that is karma?

Intention, bodily and verbal non-restraint and non-manifest karma, tainted bodily and verbal restraint and non-manifest karma, right speech, right action, and right livelihood - this is called the dharma element that is karma.
What is the dharma element that is not karma?

Excluding intention, bodily and verbal non-restraint and non-manifest karma, tainted bodily and verbal restraint and non-manifest karma, right speech, right action, and right livelihood, the remaining dharma element that is not karma is called the dharma element that is not karma.
Among the twelve sense bases, how many are associated with karma and how many are not associated with karma?

One is associated with karma, ten are not associated with karma, and one is threefold, either associated with karma, not associated with karma, or not described as either associated with karma or not associated with karma.
What is the one that is associated with karma?
The sense base of mind - this is called the one that is associated with karma.
What are the ten that are not associated with karma?
The ten sense bases of form are called the ten that are not associated with action.
What is the one that is threefold, either associated with action, or not associated with action, or not said to be either associated with or not associated with action?

The sense base of mental objects is called the one that is threefold, either associated with action, or not associated with action, or not said to be either associated with or not associated with action.
What is the sense base of mental objects that is associated with action?

If the sense base of mental objects is associated with intention, except for intention, the rest are feeling, perception, up to the contaminants of the realms of existence, this is called the sense base of mental objects that is associated with action.
What is the sense base of mental objects that is not associated with action?

If the sense base of mental objects is not associated with intention, up to the cognition of the base of neither-perception-nor-non-perception, this is called the sense base of mental objects that is not associated with action.
What is the sense base of mental objects that is not said to be either associated with or not associated with action?
Intention, this is called the sense base of mental objects that is not said to be either associated with or not associated with action.
Among the twelve sense bases, how many are shared by action, and how many are not shared by action?
One is shared karma, ten are not shared karma, and one is partially shared karma or not shared karma.
What is shared karma?
The mind faculty is called shared karma.
What are the ten that are not shared karma?
The ten form faculties are called the ten that are not shared karma.
What is the one that is partially shared karma or not shared karma?
The dharma faculty.
This is called the one that is partially shared karma or not shared karma.
What is the shared karma in the dharma faculty?

If the dharma faculty follows karma, arises with shared karma, abides with shared karma, perishes with shared karma, feeling, perception, concentration, thought, contact, up to afflictions, fetters, attainment of non-perception, attainment of cessation, bodily and verbal non-manifestation with outflows, bodily vigor with outflows, bodily exertion with outflows, right speech, right action, right livelihood, right effort, and right exertion - this is called the shared karma in the dharma faculty.
What is the non-shared karma in the dharma faculty?

If the element of mental objects does not follow karma, it does not arise together with karma, does not abide together, and does not cease together with karma. It is not the mind, volition, birth, old age and death, life, bonds, attainment of fruits, bodily and verbal non-virtuous actions without expression, bodily and verbal virtuous actions without expression with outflows, bodily vigor, and the nine unconditioned dharmas. This is called the element of mental objects that is not common with karma.
Following karma and not following karma are also like this.
Among the twelve sense bases, how many are causes and how many are not causes?
One is a cause, seven are not causes, four are twofold, either causes or not causes.
What is the one cause?
The sense base of mind, this is called the one cause.
What are the seven that are not causes?
The sense bases of eye, ear, nose, tongue, body, smell, and taste, these are called the seven that are not causes.
What are the four that are twofold, either causes or not causes?
The sense bases of form, sound, touch, and mental objects, these are called the four that are twofold, either causes or not causes.
What is the sense base of form that is a cause?
If the form sense base is a resultant phenomenon, it is called the form sense base cause.
What is the form sense base cause?
If the form sense base is produced by wholesome or unwholesome thoughts, such as going, coming, bending, stretching, turning the body, and bodily intimation, it is called the form sense base cause.
What is the form sense base not cause?

If the form sense base is a resultant, or if the form sense base is not a resultant, if the bodily good form, bad form, beauty, ugliness, smoothness, roughness, and purity are produced by indeterminate thoughts, such as going, coming, turning, bending, stretching, and bodily intimation, or if external form is cognized by the eye consciousness, it is called the form sense base not cause.
What is the sound sense base cause?
If the sound sense base is a resultant phenomenon, it is called the sound sense base cause.
What is the sound sense base cause?

If the sound sense base is wholesome or unwholesome, if it is produced by wholesome or unwholesome thoughts, such as the collection of sounds, words, speech, and verbal intimation, it is called the sound sense base cause.
What is the sound sense base not cause?

If the sound element is retribution, or if the sound element is not retribution, the sound element of the body that is neither good nor bad, neither subtle nor coarse, neither soft nor harsh, arisen from a neutral mind, the collection of sounds, phrases, and words, and the teachings of the mouth, or external sounds cognized by the ear consciousness, this is called the sound element that is not a cause.
What is the cause of the touch element?
The four great elements: the earth element, water element, wind element, and fire element, this is called the cause of the touch element.
What is the touch element that is not a cause?
Excluding the four great elements, the remaining touch element dharmas, this is called the touch element that is not a cause.
What is the cause of the dharma element?

The dharma element that is a condition, or the dharma element that is not a condition but has retribution, excluding the attainment of the fruit, the remaining dharma element that is not a condition but has good retribution, the feelings, perceptions, up to the defilements, the two concentrations, the bonds, and all forms, this is called the cause of the dharma element.
What is the dharma element that is not a cause?

If a dharma belongs to the sense-field of mental objects, is without retribution, is not common karma, is birth, old age, death, life, attainment of fruit, the body with impurities, the nine [roots], or is unconditioned, it is called the sense-field of mental objects that is not a cause.
How many of the twelve sense bases have causes and how many do not have causes?
Eleven have causes, and one is twofold, either having causes or not having causes.
What are the eleven that have causes?
The ten sense bases of form and the sense base of mind, these are called the eleven that have causes.
What is the one that is twofold, either having causes or not having causes?
The sense base of mental objects, this is called the one that is twofold, either having causes or not having causes.
What is the sense base of mental objects that has causes?
If the sense base of mental objects has continuity, is feeling, perception, up to right concentration, and is the exception of the body, it is called the sense base of mental objects that has causes.
What is the sense base of mental objects that does not have causes?

If the sense base of mental objects does not have continuity, is knowledge, the exhaustion of the substratum of existence, up to the sphere of neither-perception-nor-non-perception, it is called the sense base of mental objects that does not have causes.
With thread, without thread, with cause, without cause, with conditions, without conditions, conditioned, unconditioned, are also like this.
How many of the twelve sense bases are knowledge, and how many are not knowledge?
All are knowledge, knowing things as they are, seeing.
How many of the twelve sense bases are consciousness, and how many are not consciousness?
All are consciousness, mental consciousness, knowing things as they are.
How many of the twelve sense bases are understanding, and how many are not understanding?
All are understanding, knowing things as they are, seeing.
How many of the twelve sense bases are realization, and how many are not realization?
All are realization, knowing things as they are, seeing.
How many of the twelve sense bases are known by the knowledge of elimination, and how many are not known by the knowledge of elimination?
Eight are not known by the knowledge of elimination, four are twofold, either known by the knowledge of elimination or not known by the knowledge of elimination.
What are the eight that are not known by the knowledge of elimination?

The eye sense base, ear sense base, nose sense base, tongue sense base, body sense base, smell sense base, taste sense base, and touch sense base - these are the eight that are not known by the knowledge of elimination.
What are the four that are twofold, either known by the knowledge of elimination or not known by the knowledge of elimination?

The form sense-sphere, sound sense-sphere, mind sense-sphere, and dharma sense-sphere are called the four twofold sense-spheres, which may be known through the knowledge of elimination or not known through the knowledge of elimination.
How is the form sense-sphere known through the knowledge of elimination?

If the form sense-sphere is unwholesome, and the going, coming, bending, stretching, and bodily communication produced by an unwholesome mind, this is called the form sense-sphere known through the knowledge of elimination.
How is the form sense-sphere not known through the knowledge of elimination?

The form sense-sphere, whether wholesome or indeterminate, the bodily good form, bad form, smooth skin, rough skin, pure and impure, and the going, coming, bending, stretching, and bodily communication produced by a wholesome or indeterminate mind, and the external form cognized by the eye-consciousness, this is called the form sense-sphere not known through the knowledge of elimination.
How is the sound sense-sphere known through the knowledge of elimination?

If the sound sense-sphere is unwholesome, and the sounds, words, phrases, and verbal communication produced by an unwholesome mind, this is called the sound sense-sphere known through the knowledge of elimination.
How is the sound sense-sphere not known through the knowledge of elimination?

If the sound is wholesome or indeterminate, whether the voice is good or bad, exquisite or not exquisite, soft or not soft, arising from a wholesome or indeterminate mind, the collection of sounds, words, and phrases, oral instructions, or external sounds cognized by the ear consciousness, this is called the sound element not to be known through the knowledge of elimination.
What is the mind element to be known through the knowledge of elimination?
If the mind element is unwholesome, the mind realm and mental consciousness realm, this is called the mind element to be known through the knowledge of elimination.
What is the mind element not to be known through the knowledge of elimination?
The mind element, whether wholesome or indeterminate, eye consciousness up to mental consciousness, this is called the mind element not to be known through the knowledge of elimination.
What is the dharma element to be known through the knowledge of elimination?

If the elements of the sense-spheres are unwholesome, the feelings, perceptions, volition, contact, applied thought, sustained thought, views, wisdom, liberation, remorse, non-remorse, satisfaction, joy, mental exertion, faith, desire, mindfulness, doubt, fear, defilements, fetters, bodily and verbal non-virtuous non-intimation, and defiled bodily exertion, they are known by the knowledge of elimination.
What is the element of the sense-spheres not known by the knowledge of elimination?

Excluding the fetters, bodily and verbal non-virtuous non-intimation, the remaining elements of the sense-spheres are not known by the knowledge of elimination. This is called the element of the sense-spheres not known by the knowledge of elimination.
Elimination and non-elimination are also like this.
How many of the twelve sense-spheres are cultivated and how many are not cultivated?
Eight are not cultivated, four are twofold, either cultivated or not cultivated.
What are the eight that are not cultivated?
The sense-spheres of the eye, ear, nose, tongue, body, smell, taste, and touch are called the eight that are not cultivated.
What are the four that are twofold, either cultivated or not cultivated?
The form sense base, sound sense base, mind sense base, and mental object sense base are called the four twofold bases, which are either cultivated or not cultivated.
What is the form sense base that is cultivated?
The form sense base that is produced by wholesome thoughts, such as going, coming, bending, stretching, and turning the body, is called the form sense base that is cultivated.
What is the form sense base that is not cultivated?

The form sense base that is unwholesome or indeterminate, such as good bodily form, bad bodily form, dignified appearance, undignified appearance, smooth skin, rough skin, pure and clean, or impure and unclean, that is produced by unwholesome or indeterminate thoughts, such as going, coming, bending, stretching, and turning the body, or external forms cognized by the eye consciousness, are called the form sense base that is not cultivated.
What is the sound sense base that is cultivated?
The sound sense base that is wholesome, such as the sounds of speech, language, and oral instruction produced by wholesome thoughts, is called the sound sense base that is cultivated.
What is the sound sense base that is not cultivated?

If the sound element is unwholesome or indeterminate, and the pleasant sound, unpleasant sound, subtle sound, coarse sound, wholesome mind, or indeterminate mind gives rise to the collection of sounds, phrases, and speech, or if external sounds are known by the ear consciousness, this is called the sound element that is not cultivated.
What is the mind element that is cultivated?
The mind element that is wholesome, the mind consciousness element, is called the mind element that is cultivated.
What is the mind element that is not cultivated?
The mind element that is unwholesome or indeterminate, eye consciousness up to mind consciousness, is called the mind element that is not cultivated.
What is the dharma element that is cultivated?

The dharma element that is wholesome feeling, perception, up to thought, equanimity, attainment of the formless absorptions, attainment of the cessation of perception and feeling, bodily and verbal non-manifestation with outflows, bodily vigor with outflows, bodily abandonment with outflows, right effort, right action, right livelihood, right vigor, and right abandonment, and the extinction resulting from the elimination of contaminants through wisdom, is called the dharma element that is cultivated.
What is the dharma element that is not cultivated?

If the elements are unwholesome or indeterminate, such as feeling, perception, volition, contact, applied thought, sustained thought, view, wisdom, liberation, remorse, non-remorse, joy, delight, mental exertion, faith, desire, mindfulness, doubt, fear, defilements, latent tendencies, birth, aging and death, life, bonds, bodily and verbal non-virtuous non-intimation, contaminated bodily exertion that is not noble, and the seven unconditioned things, they are called the elements that are not cultivated.
How many of the twelve sense bases are realized, and how many are not realized?
All are realized, known as they are, seen.
How many of the twelve sense bases are wholesome, how many are unwholesome, and how many are indeterminate?
Eight are indeterminate, four are threefold, either wholesome, unwholesome, or indeterminate.
What are the eight indeterminate ones?
The eye sense base, ear sense base, nose sense base, tongue sense base, body sense base, smell sense base, taste sense base, and touch sense base are called the eight indeterminate ones.
What are the four that are threefold, either wholesome, unwholesome, or indeterminate?
The form sense base, sound sense base, mind sense base, and dharma sense base are called the four and a half that can be either wholesome, unwholesome, or indeterminate.
What is the form sense base that is wholesome?
If the form sense base arises from wholesome thoughts, such as going, coming, bending, stretching, and bodily actions, it is called the form sense base that is wholesome.
What is the form sense base that is not wholesome?
If the form sense base arises from unwholesome thoughts, such as going, coming, bending, stretching, and bodily actions, it is called the form sense base that is not wholesome.
What is the form sense base that is indeterminate?

If the form sense base is experienced, or if the form sense base is not a retribution, and the bodily good form, bad form, dignified, not dignified, smooth, not smooth, pure, not pure, arises from indeterminate thoughts, such as going, coming, bending, stretching, and bodily actions, or if external form is known by the eye consciousness, it is called the form sense base that is indeterminate.
What is the sound sense base that is wholesome?
If the sound sense base arises from wholesome thoughts, such as the collection of sounds, words, speech, and verbal actions, it is called the sound sense base that is wholesome.
How is the sound sense base unwholesome?
If the sound sense base arises from an unwholesome mind, such as the sounds of speech, language, and oral instructions, it is called the sound sense base that is unwholesome.
How is the sound sense base indeterminate?

If the sound sense base is experienced, or if the sound sense base is neither a result nor a resultant phenomenon, such as pleasant or unpleasant sounds, refined or unrefined sounds, soft or harsh sounds, and the sounds of speech, language, and oral instructions arising from an indeterminate mind, or if external sounds are cognized by the ear consciousness, it is called the sound sense base that is indeterminate.
How is the mind sense base wholesome?
If the mind sense base is cultivated, such as the mind element, the mental consciousness element, it is called the mind sense base that is wholesome.
How is the mind sense base unwholesome?
If the mind sense base is severed, such as the mind element, the mental consciousness element, it is called the mind sense base that is unwholesome.
How is the mind sense base indeterminate?

If the mind sense base is experienced, or if the mind sense base is neither a result nor a resultant phenomenon, such as the eye consciousness up to the mental consciousness, it is called the mind sense base that is indeterminate.
What are the wholesome factors included in the element of mental objects?

If the factors included in the element of mental objects are wholesome, such as feeling, perception, volition, contact, attention, the attainment of the formless realm, the attainment of the cessation of perception and feeling, the bodily and verbal non-manifestations of precepts, the wholesome bodily vigor, the wholesome bodily abandonment, right effort, right abandonment, knowledge resulting from resolve, this is called the wholesome factors included in the element of mental objects.
What are the unwholesome factors included in the element of mental objects?

If the factors included in the element of mental objects are unwholesome, such as feeling, perception, intention, contact, reflection, investigation, view, wisdom, liberation, remorse, non-remorse, satisfaction, joy, mental vigor, faith, desire, mindfulness, doubt, fear, the fetters, the bodily and verbal non-manifestations of precepts, the unwholesome bodily vigor, this is called the unwholesome factors included in the element of mental objects.
What are the indeterminate factors included in the element of mental objects?

If a dharma element is a feeling, or if a dharma element is not a retribution, it is a non-retribution dharma. The non-holy unconditioned, feeling, conception, volition, contact, applied thought, sustained thought, view, wisdom, liberation, remorse, non-remorse, joy, delight, mental exertion, faith, desire, mindfulness, fear, birth, old age and death, life, and the impure mental exertion, and the seven unconditioned dharmas, are called the indeterminate dharma element.
Among the twelve sense bases, how many are learner, how many are post-learner, and how many are neither learner nor post-learner?
Ten are neither learner nor post-learner, two are divided into three parts, either learner, post-learner, or neither learner nor post-learner.
What are the ten that are neither learner nor post-learner?
The ten material sense bases, these are called the ten that are neither learner nor post-learner.
What are the two that are divided into three parts, either learner, post-learner, or neither learner nor post-learner?
The mind sense base and the dharma sense base, these are called the two that are divided into three parts, either learner, post-learner, or neither learner nor post-learner.
What is the learner mind sense base?
If the mind faculty enters the noble path but is not post-learner, it is called the mind faculty of a learner.
What is the mind faculty of a learner?
If the mind faculty of a learner is associated with the faculty of faith, the mind element and the mind consciousness element, it is called the mind faculty of a learner.
What is the mind faculty of a learner?

Learners who have eliminated the bonds, whose minds enter the noble path, whether of firm faith or of firm Dharma or of other inclinations, who see the faults of conditioned existence and contemplate the cessation of suffering as peace,

who contemplate the truth of suffering, its arising, its cessation, and the path as they truly are, who desire to attain what has not been attained, to understand what has not been understood, and to realize what has not been realized, who cultivate the path of detachment from afflictions, who are learners such as stream-enterers, once-returners, or non-returners, who are fully endowed with the wisdom of contemplation, who have the stage of wisdom and the liberation of contemplation, who immediately realize the fruits of the Å›ramaá¹‡a, whether the fruit of stream-entry, the fruit of once-returning, or the fruit of non-returning,
whether real people or those on the path, the mind element and the mind consciousness element, this is called the mind faculty of a learner.
What is the mind faculty of a post-learner?
If the mind faculty enters the noble path but is not a learner, it is called the mind faculty of a post-learner.
What is the mind faculty of a post-learner?
If the mind faculty of a post-learner is associated with the faculty of faith, the mind element and the mental consciousness element, it is called the mind faculty of a post-learner.
What is the mind faculty of a post-learner?

A post-learner who wishes to attain arhatship, who has not yet attained the noble Dharma, who wishes to cultivate the path, who is fully endowed with insight and wisdom, who has attained the stage of wisdom and liberation of mind, and who has attained the fruit of arhatship.
If it is a real person, a destination, or the mind element and mental consciousness element, it is called the mind faculty of a post-learner.
What is the mind faculty that is neither a learner nor a post-learner?

If the mind faculty does not enter the noble path and is not associated with the aggregate of consciousness, such as eye consciousness up to mental consciousness, it is called the mind faculty that is neither a learner nor a post-learner.
What is the dharma element of a learner?
If the dharma element enters the noble path but is not a post-learner, it is called the dharma element of a learner.
What is the dharma element of a learner?

The faculty of faith and the associated mental factors of faith in the learner stage, if the dharmas are not conditioned by the uncontaminated and not of the learner stage, are called the dharma element of the learner.
What is the dharma element of the learner?
A learner, having eliminated the defilements, enters the noble path with a noble mind, and up to attaining the fruit of non-returner.

If it is a real person, a destination, or feeling, perception, intention, contact, thought, initial thought, view, wisdom, liberation, non-delusion, faith-following, joy, mental exertion, mental purification, faith, desire, heedfulness, mindfulness, concentration, equanimity, attainment of the fruit, attainment of cessation, right speech, right action, right livelihood, right effort, and right purification of behavior, this is called the dharma element of the learner.
What is the dharma element of the post-learner?
If the dharma element is noble but not of the learner stage, it is called the dharma element of the post-learner.
What is the dharma element of the post-learner?

The faculty of faith of the post-learner and the mental factors associated with the faculty of faith, whether included in the element of dharmas or not, that are not conditioned by the uncontaminated state of the learner, are called the element of dharmas of the post-learner.
What is the element of dharmas of the post-learner?
A post-learner, up to attaining the fruit of arhatship.

If it is a real person, a destination, or feeling, perception, intention, contact, thought, initial thought, sustained thought, view, wisdom, liberation, non-delusion, faith-following, satisfaction, joy, mental exertion, mental purification, faith, desire, heedfulness, mindfulness, concentration, equanimity, attainment of the fruit, attainment of cessation, right speech, right action, right livelihood, right effort, right purification of body, or the extinction resulting from discrimination, this is called the element of dharmas of the post-learner.
What is the element of dharmas that is neither a learner nor a post-learner?

If the elements of dharmas are not the aggregates of noble feeling, perception, or formation, or if form is invisible and unimpeded, defiled, not noble, or unconditioned feeling and perception, up to the attainment of concentration, the first four formless states, and the seven unconditioned of the non-noble, these are called the element of dharmas that are neither learners nor post-learners.
Among the twelve sense bases, how many are results, how many are dharmas that are results, and how many are neither results nor dharmas that are results?

Five are results, three are in two parts, either results or neither results nor dharmas that are results, four are in three parts, either results, dharmas that are results, or neither results nor dharmas that are results.
What are the five results?
The sense bases of eye, ear, nose, tongue, and body, these are called the five results.
What are the three in two parts, either results or neither results nor dharmas that are results?
The sense bases of smell, taste, and touch, these are called the three in two parts, either results or neither results nor dharmas that are results.
What are the four in three parts, either results, dharmas that are results, or neither results nor dharmas that are results?

The form sense-sphere, sound sense-sphere, mind sense-sphere, and dharma sense-sphere are called the four and a half sense-spheres that are either retribution, dharmas that are retribution, or neither retribution nor dharmas that are retribution.
What is the retribution sense-sphere of smell?
If the smell sense-sphere is experienced, it is called the retribution sense-sphere of smell.
What is the retribution sense-sphere of smell?

If the smell sense-sphere is produced by karma and afflictions, it is my part of the body's good smell, bad smell, soft smell, not soft smell, pleasing smell, and displeasing smell. This is called the retribution sense-sphere of smell.
What is the smell sense-sphere that is neither retribution nor dharmas that are retribution?

If the smell sense-sphere is external, or if external smells are known by the nose consciousness, such as the smell of tree roots, the smell of tree heartwood, the smell of tree sap, the smell of tree bark, the smell of leaves, the smell of flowers, the smell of fruits, good smells, bad smells, and other external smells known by the nose consciousness, this is called the smell sense-sphere that is neither retribution nor dharmas that are retribution.
What is the retribution sense-sphere of taste?
If the taste sense-sphere is experienced, it is called the retribution sense-sphere of taste.
What is the retribution sense-sphere of taste?

If the taste element arises from karmic dharmas and afflictions, and is included in the retribution of the self, such as the sweetness, sourness, bitterness, spiciness, saltiness, and saliva of the body, this is called the retribution of the taste element.
What is the taste element that is neither retribution nor the dharmas of retribution?

If the taste element is external, or if the external taste element is cognized by the tongue consciousness, such as sweetness, sourness, bitterness, spiciness, saltiness, water, and other external tastes cognized by the tongue consciousness, this is called the taste element that is neither retribution nor the dharmas of retribution.
What is the retribution of the touch element?
If the touch element is feeling, this is called the retribution of the touch element.
What is the touch element that is retribution?

If the touch element arises from karmic dharmas and afflictions, and is included in the retribution of the self, such as the cold, heat, lightness, heaviness, roughness, smoothness, hardness, and softness of the body, this is called the touch element that is retribution.
What is the touch element that is neither retribution nor the dharmas of retribution?

If the touch element is external, or if the external touch element is cognized by the body consciousness, such as cold, heat, lightness, heaviness, roughness, smoothness, hardness, and softness, and other external touches cognized by the body consciousness, this is called the touch element that is neither retribution nor the dharmas of retribution.
What is the form element that is a result?
If the form element is experienced, it is called the form element that is a result.
What is the form element that is a result?

If the form element arises from karma, dharmas, and afflictions, it is a result, included in the self-nature, and the good color, non-good color, beauty, non-beauty, smoothness, non-smoothness, and purity of the body, and the bodily action of going, coming, bending, stretching, and turning that arises from feeling and mind, it is called the form element that is a result.
What is the form element that is a result of a dharma?
If the form element has a result, it is called the form element that is a result of a dharma.
What is the form element that is a result of a dharma?

If the form element is wholesome or unwholesome, and the bodily action of going, coming, bending, stretching, and turning that arises from a wholesome or unwholesome mind, it is called the form element that is a result of a dharma.
What is the form element that is neither a result nor a result of a dharma?

If the form sense base is indeterminate, not included in my category, neither a result nor a result of retribution, and arises from the mind, such as past, future, bending, stretching, turning, bodily expression, or external form cognized by the eye consciousness, this is called the form sense base that is neither a result nor a result of retribution.
What is the sound sense base that is a result?
If the sound sense base is experienced, this is called the sound sense base that is a result.
What is the sound sense base that is a result of retribution?

If the sound sense base arises from karma and afflictions, is a result of retribution included in my category, such as a good voice, bad voice, wonderful voice, not wonderful voice, soft voice, not soft voice, and bodily expression arising from the mind, such as the collection of sounds, phrases, speech, and verbal expression, this is called the sound sense base that is a result of retribution.
What is the sound sense base that is a result of wholesome activities?
If the sound sense base has a result, this is called the sound sense base that is a result of wholesome activities.
What is the sound sense base that is a result of wholesome activities?

If the sound sense base is wholesome or unwholesome, and arises from a wholesome or unwholesome mind, such as the collection of sounds, phrases, speech, and verbal expression, this is called the sound sense base that is a result of wholesome activities.
What is the sound sense base that is neither a result nor a result of wholesome activities?

If the sound element is indeterminate and not included in my category, it is neither a result nor a resultant dharma, but arises from the combination of sound, voice, words, and speech. If external sounds are cognized by the ear consciousness, this is called the sound element that is neither a result nor a resultant dharma.
What is the mind element that is a result?
If the mind element is experienced, or if the mind element is a wholesome result, such as eye consciousness up to mind consciousness, this is called the mind element that is a result.
What is the mind element that is a resultant dharma?
If the mind element has a result, this is called the mind element that is a resultant dharma.
What is the mind element that is a resultant dharma?

Excluding the wholesome mind element that is a result, the other wholesome mind element, as well as the unwholesome mind element, mind consciousness element, are called the mind element that is a resultant dharma.
What is the mind element that is neither a result nor a resultant dharma?

If the mind element is indeterminate and not included in my category, such as eye consciousness up to mind consciousness, this is called the mind element that is neither a result nor a resultant dharma.
What is the dharma element that is a result?

If a dharma enters feeling or a dharma enters good retribution, except for non-greed and non-hatred, the remaining feelings, perceptions, up to mind, equanimity, fear, birth, life, attainment of non-perception, attainment of cessation, impure bodily and verbal precepts, impure bodily vigor, impure bodily abandonment, right speech, right action, right livelihood, right bodily vigor, and right bodily abandonment, are called dharmas that enter retribution.
What are dharmas that enter retribution?
If a dharma enters retribution, it is called a dharma that enters retribution.
What are dharmas that enter retribution?

Except for dharmas that enter good retribution, the remaining dharmas that enter good and conditioned, if unwholesome, feelings, perceptions, up to the defilements, bonds, and two concentrations, all forms, are called dharmas that enter retribution.
What are dharmas that neither enter retribution nor are retribution?

If a dharma element is neutral and not included in my category, if it is the holy unconditioned, or feeling, perception, volition, contact, applied thought, sustained thought, view, wisdom, liberation, regret, non-regret, joy, delight, mental exertion, faith, desire, mindfulness, fear, birth, old age and death, or defiled bodily exertion, or the nine unconditioned dharmas, this is called the dharma element that is neither a result nor a dharma that produces a result.

Among the twelve sense bases, how many are to be eliminated by seeing, how many are to be eliminated by cultivation, and how many are neither to be eliminated by seeing nor to be eliminated by cultivation?

Eight are neither to be eliminated by seeing nor to be eliminated by cultivation. Four are divided into three parts: some are to be eliminated by seeing, some are to be eliminated by cultivation, and some are neither to be eliminated by seeing nor to be eliminated by cultivation.
What are the eight that are neither to be eliminated by seeing nor to be eliminated by cultivation?

The eye sense base, ear sense base, nose sense base, tongue sense base, body sense base, smell sense base, taste sense base, and touch sense base - these are the eight that are neither to be eliminated by seeing nor to be eliminated by cultivation.

What are the four that are divided into three parts: some are to be eliminated by seeing, some are to be eliminated by cultivation, and some are neither to be eliminated by seeing nor to be eliminated by cultivation?

The form sense-sphere, sound sense-sphere, mind sense-sphere, and dharma sense-sphere are called the four and a half sense-spheres that are either to be eliminated by seeing, or to be eliminated by cultivation, or neither to be eliminated by seeing nor to be eliminated by cultivation.
What is the form sense-sphere to be eliminated by seeing?

If the form sense-sphere is unwholesome, not to be eliminated by cultivation, and arises from the mind that is to be eliminated by seeing, such as going, coming, bending, stretching, and turning of the body, this is called the form sense-sphere to be eliminated by seeing.
What is the form sense-sphere to be eliminated by cultivation?
