If the form sense-sphere is unwholesome, not to be eliminated by seeing, and arises from the mind that is to be eliminated by cultivation, such as going, coming, bending, stretching, and turning of the body, this is called the form sense-sphere to be eliminated by cultivation.
What is the form sense-sphere neither to be eliminated by seeing nor to be eliminated by cultivation?

If the form sense base is wholesome or indeterminate, the bodily good form, bad form, gracefulness, ungracefulness, smoothness, roughness, and purity are arisen from wholesome or indeterminate minds, and the bodily actions of going, coming, bending, stretching, and turning, and the external forms cognized by the eye consciousness, this is called the form sense base that is neither to be eliminated by seeing nor by cultivation.
What is the sound sense base to be eliminated by seeing?

If the sound sense base is unwholesome and to be eliminated by seeing, and the sounds, voices, phrases, and words arisen from the mind of defilements to be eliminated by seeing, this is called the sound sense base to be eliminated by seeing.
What is the sound sense base to be eliminated by cultivation?

If the sound sense base is unwholesome and to be eliminated by cultivation, and the sounds, voices, phrases, and words arisen from the mind of defilements to be eliminated by cultivation, this is called the sound sense base to be eliminated by cultivation.
What is the sound sense base that is neither to be eliminated by seeing nor by cultivation?

If the sound element is wholesome or indeterminate, such as the pleasant sounds of the body, unpleasant sounds, wonderful sounds, non-wonderful sounds, soft sounds, or harsh sounds, or if it arises from wholesome or indeterminate thoughts, such as the sounds, words, phrases, and teachings of speech, or if it is external sounds cognized by the ear consciousness, this is called the sound element that is neither to be eliminated by seeing nor by cultivation.
What is the mind element to be eliminated by seeing?
If the mind element is unwholesome and to be eliminated by seeing, associated with the defilements to be eliminated by seeing, this is called the mind element to be eliminated by seeing.
What is the mind element to be eliminated by cultivation?

If the mind element is unwholesome and to be eliminated by cultivation, associated with the defilements to be eliminated by cultivation, this is called the mind element to be eliminated by cultivation.
What is the mind element neither to be eliminated by seeing nor by cultivation?
If the mind element is wholesome or indeterminate, such as the eye consciousness up to the mind consciousness, this is called the mind element neither to be eliminated by seeing nor by cultivation.
What is the dharma element to be eliminated by seeing?

If a dharma element is unwholesome and not eliminated by contemplation, it is eliminated by views and eliminated simultaneously with the defilements. Feeling, perception, volition, contact, contemplation, applied thought, sustained thought, views, wisdom, liberation, remorse, non-remorse, satisfaction, joy, mental exertion, faith, desire, mindfulness, doubt, fear, defilements, latent tendencies, bonds, bodily and verbal misconduct, unwholesome bodily exertion - this is called the dharma element eliminated by views.
What is the dharma element eliminated by contemplation?

If a dharma element is unwholesome and not eliminated by views, it is eliminated by contemplation and eliminated simultaneously with the defilements. Feeling, perception, volition, contact, contemplation, applied thought, sustained thought, views, wisdom, liberation, remorse, non-remorse, satisfaction, joy, mental exertion, faith, desire, mindfulness, doubt, fear, defilements, latent tendencies, bonds, bodily and verbal misconduct, unwholesome bodily exertion - this is called the dharma element eliminated by contemplation.
What is the dharma element not eliminated by views or contemplation?

If a dharma enters the wholesome or indeterminate, excluding doubt, afflictions, fetters, and unwholesome bodily and verbal actions, the remaining dharmas are not seen to be eliminated, nor are they eliminated by contemplation.

Among the twelve sense bases, how many are causes of elimination by seeing, how many are causes of elimination by contemplation, and how many are neither causes of elimination by seeing nor causes of elimination by contemplation?
All are threefold: either causes of elimination by seeing, or causes of elimination by contemplation, or neither causes of elimination by seeing nor causes of elimination by contemplation.
How is the eye sense base a cause of elimination by seeing?

If the eye sense base is the retribution of dharmas eliminated by seeing, the eye sense base of hell beings, animals, and hungry ghosts - this is called the eye sense base that is a cause of elimination by seeing.
How is the eye sense base a cause of elimination by contemplation?

If the eye sense base is the retribution of dharmas eliminated by contemplation, the eye sense base of hell beings, animals, and hungry ghosts - this is called the eye sense base that is a cause of elimination by contemplation.
How is the eye sense base neither a cause of elimination by seeing nor a cause of elimination by contemplation?
If the eye faculty is the result of wholesome dharmas, the eye faculty in the heavens and among humans, this is called the eye faculty that is neither to be eliminated by insight nor by cultivation.
The ear faculty, nose faculty, tongue faculty, and body faculty are also like this.
What is the mind faculty that is a cause to be eliminated by insight?

If the mind faculty is to be eliminated by insight, or if the mind faculty is the result of dharmas to be eliminated by insight, the eye consciousness up to the mind consciousness, this is called the mind faculty that is a cause to be eliminated by insight.
What is the mind faculty that is a cause to be eliminated by cultivation?

If the mind faculty is the result of dharmas to be eliminated by cultivation, the eye consciousness up to the mind consciousness, this is called the mind faculty that is a cause to be eliminated by cultivation.
What is the mind faculty that is neither a cause to be eliminated by insight nor by cultivation?

If the mind faculty is wholesome, or if the mind faculty is the result of wholesome dharmas, or if the mind faculty is neither a result nor a dharma resulting from action, the eye consciousness up to the mind consciousness, this is called the mind faculty that is neither a cause to be eliminated by insight nor by cultivation.
What is the form faculty that is a cause to be eliminated by insight?

If the form sense base is to be eliminated by seeing, if the form sense base is the retribution of dharmas to be eliminated by seeing, the body is not of good color, not well-proportioned, not smooth, not pure, and the bodily actions of going, coming, bending, stretching, and turning that arise from the mind eliminated by seeing - this is called the form sense base whose cause is to be eliminated by seeing.
What is the form sense base whose cause is to be eliminated by contemplation?

If the form sense base is to be eliminated by contemplation, if the form sense base is the retribution of dharmas to be eliminated by contemplation, the body is not of good color, not well-proportioned, not smooth, not pure, and the bodily actions of going, coming, bending, stretching, and turning that arise from the mind eliminated by contemplation - this is called the form sense base whose cause is to be eliminated by contemplation.
What is the form sense base whose cause is neither to be eliminated by seeing nor by contemplation?

If form belongs to wholesome [karma], if form is the retribution of wholesome dharmas, if form is neither retribution nor a dharma of retribution, if it is the beautiful color of the body, dignified and well-proportioned, well-arranged and pure, not to be eliminated by seeing [the four noble truths], not to be eliminated by contemplation, and arises from the mind, such as going, coming, bending, stretching, and turning the body, and bodily expression, or if external form is known by the eye consciousness, this is called the form element that is neither to be eliminated by seeing nor by contemplation.
What is the sound element whose cause is to be eliminated by seeing?

If the sound element is to be eliminated by seeing, if the sound element is the retribution of dharmas to be eliminated by seeing, if the sound of the body is not good, not of various kinds, not soft, and arises from the cause of dharmas to be eliminated by seeing, such as the collection of sounds, words, and speech that arise from the mind, this is called the sound element whose cause is to be eliminated by seeing.
What is the sound element whose cause is to be eliminated by contemplation?

If the sound element is to be eliminated by contemplation, if the sound element is the retribution of dharmas to be eliminated by contemplation, if the sound of the body is not good, not of various kinds, not soft, and arises from the cause of dharmas to be eliminated by contemplation, such as the collection of sounds, words, and speech that arise from the mind, this is called the sound element whose cause is to be eliminated by contemplation.
How is the sound sense base not to be eliminated by seeing or by cultivation, and its cause?

If the sound sense base is wholesome, or if the sound sense base is the result of wholesome dharmas, or if the sound sense base is not a result or a dharma that produces results, such as the sound of a beautiful body, the sound of a multitude, the soft sound, the sound not to be eliminated by seeing or by cultivation, produced by the mind, the collection of sounds, phrases, and speech, the oral instructions, or if it is an external sound cognized by the ear consciousness, this is called the sound sense base not to be eliminated by seeing or by cultivation, and its cause.
How is the smell sense base the cause to be eliminated by seeing?

If the smell sense base is the result of dharmas to be eliminated by seeing, such as the smell of an unpleasant body, the smell of something not soft, the smell of something disagreeable, this is called the smell sense base the cause to be eliminated by seeing.
How is the smell sense base the cause to be eliminated by cultivation?

If the smell sense base is the result of dharmas to be eliminated by cultivation, such as the smell of an unpleasant body, the smell of something not soft, the smell of something disagreeable, this is called the smell sense base the cause to be eliminated by cultivation.
How is the smell sense base not to be eliminated by seeing or by cultivation, and its cause?

If the olfactory sphere is the result of wholesome dharmas, or if the olfactory sphere is neither the result nor the cause of the result, the fragrance of the body's good features, the fragrance of softness, the fragrance of pleasantness, or external fragrances cognized by the nose consciousness, this is called the olfactory sphere that is neither to be eliminated by seeing nor by cultivation.
What is the gustatory sphere that is the cause of what is to be eliminated by seeing?

If the gustatory sphere is the result of dharmas to be eliminated by seeing, the sweetness, sourness, bitterness, spiciness, saltiness, or astringency of the body, this is called the gustatory sphere that is the cause of what is to be eliminated by seeing.
What is the gustatory sphere that is the cause of what is to be eliminated by cultivation?

If the gustatory sphere is the result of dharmas to be eliminated by cultivation, the sweetness, sourness, bitterness, spiciness, saltiness, or astringency of the body, this is called the gustatory sphere that is the cause of what is to be eliminated by cultivation.
What is the gustatory sphere that is neither the cause of what is to be eliminated by seeing nor by cultivation?

If the gustatory sphere is the result of wholesome dharmas, or if the gustatory sphere is neither the result nor the cause of the result, the sweetness, sourness, bitterness, spiciness, saltiness, or astringency of the body, or external tastes cognized by the tongue consciousness, this is called the gustatory sphere that is neither to be eliminated by seeing nor by cultivation.
What is the tactile sphere that is the cause of what is to be eliminated by seeing?

If the cold, hot, coarse, heavy, hard, and rough sensations of the body that are the retribution for the dharmas to be eliminated by seeing are the contact element, this is called the contact element that is the cause to be eliminated by seeing.
What is the contact element that is the cause to be eliminated by contemplation?

If the cold, hot, coarse, heavy, hard, and rough sensations of the body that are the retribution for the dharmas to be eliminated by contemplation are the contact element, this is called the contact element that is the cause to be eliminated by contemplation.
What is the contact element that is neither the cause to be eliminated by seeing nor the cause to be eliminated by contemplation?

If the cold, hot, light, fine, soft, and smooth sensations of the body that are the retribution for wholesome dharmas, or if the cold, hot, light, fine, soft, and smooth sensations of the body that are not retribution, or if the external contacts that are cognized by the body consciousness, this is called the contact element that is neither the cause to be eliminated by seeing nor the cause to be eliminated by contemplation.
What is the dharma element that is the cause to be eliminated by seeing?

If a dharma enters the cause of what is eliminated by seeing, if a dharma enters or the retribution of dharmas eliminated by seeing, receiving, conception, volition, contact, applied thought, sustained thought, views, wisdom, liberation, remorse, non-remorse, satisfaction, joy, mental exertion, faith, desire, mindfulness, doubt, fear, afflictions, propensities, bonds, bodily and verbal non-restraint, unmanifest, and defiled bodily exertion, this is called the cause of what is eliminated by seeing in the dharma entrance.
What is the cause of what is eliminated by contemplation in the dharma entrance?

If a dharma enters what is eliminated by contemplation, if a dharma enters or the retribution of dharmas eliminated by contemplation, receiving, conception, volition, contact, applied thought, sustained thought, views, wisdom, liberation, remorse, non-remorse, satisfaction, joy, mental exertion, faith, desire, mindfulness, fear, afflictions, propensities, bonds, bodily and verbal non-restraint, unmanifest, and defiled bodily exertion, this is called the cause of what is eliminated by contemplation in the dharma entrance.
What is the dharma element that is neither to be eliminated by insight nor by cultivation?

If the dharma element is wholesome, the retribution of wholesome dharmas, or the dharma element that is neither retribution nor a dharma that produces retribution, except for doubt, afflictions, fetters, and the non-restraint of body and speech, the rest of the dharma element is neither to be eliminated by insight nor by cultivation. This is called the dharma element that is neither to be eliminated by insight nor by cultivation.
Among the twelve sense bases, how many are bound to the desire realm, how many are bound to the form realm, how many are bound to the formless realm, and how many are unbound?

Four are bound to the desire realm, six are of two parts, either bound to the desire realm or bound to the form realm, two are of four parts, either bound to the desire realm, bound to the form realm, bound to the formless realm, or unbound.
What are the four that are bound to the desire realm?
The sense base of the tongue, the sense base of the nose, the sense base of smell, and the sense base of taste, these are called the four that are bound to the desire realm.
What are the six that are of two parts, either bound to the desire realm or bound to the form realm?

The eye sense field, ear sense field, body sense field, form sense field, sound sense field, and tactile object sense field are called the six twofold sense fields that are either connected to the desire realm or connected to the form realm.
How are two fourfold sense fields either connected to the desire realm, connected to the form realm, connected to the formless realm, or not connected?

The mind sense field and the dharma sense field are called the two fourfold sense fields that are either connected to the desire realm, connected to the form realm, connected to the formless realm, or not connected.
How is the eye sense field connected to the desire realm?
If the eye sense field is defiled by the desire realm and defiled by existence, it is called the eye sense field connected to the desire realm.
How is the eye sense field connected to the form realm?
If the eye sense field is defiled by the form realm and defiled by existence, it is called the eye sense field connected to the form realm.
The ear sense field and the body sense field are also like this.
How is the form sense field connected to the desire realm?

If the form sense-sphere is bound to the desire realm and the existence realm, the body's good form, bad form, dignified appearance, undignified appearance, smooth skin, rough skin, and pure appearance, the bodily actions of going, coming, bending, stretching, and turning that arise from the mind of desire, and the external form cognized by the eye-consciousness that is bound to the desire realm and the existence realm, this is called the form sense-sphere bound to the desire realm.
What is the form sense-sphere bound to the form realm?

If the form sense-sphere is bound to the form realm and the existence realm, the body's good form, dignified appearance, smooth skin, pure appearance, the bodily actions of going, coming, bending, stretching, and turning that arise from the mind of form, and the external form cognized by the eye-consciousness that is bound to the form realm and the existence realm, this is called the form sense-sphere bound to the form realm.
What is the sound sense-sphere bound to the desire realm?

If the sound element is associated with the desire realm and the leakage of desire, such as pleasant sounds, unpleasant sounds, wonderful sounds, not wonderful sounds, soft sounds, and not soft sounds, the sound, voice, phrases, and language that arise from the mind of desire, or external sounds cognized by the ear consciousness that are associated with the leakage of desire and the leakage of existence, this is called the sound element bound to the desire realm.
What is the sound element bound to the form realm?

If the sound element is associated with the leakage of form, such as pleasant sounds, wonderful sounds, soft sounds, the sound, voice, phrases, and language that arise from the mind of form, or external sounds cognized by the ear consciousness that are associated with the leakage of form and the leakage of existence, this is called the sound element bound to the form realm.
What is the touch element bound to the desire realm?

If the touch element is associated with the leakage of desire and the leakage of existence, such as cold, heat, lightness, heaviness, roughness, smoothness, hardness, and softness of the body, or external touches cognized by the body consciousness that are associated with the leakage of desire and the leakage of existence, this is called the touch element bound to the desire realm.
What is the touch element bound to the form realm?

If the tactile sense faculty enters form, contaminated by defilements, and experiences cold, heat, lightness, heaviness, roughness, smoothness, or if external tactile objects are cognized by the tactile consciousness and form is contaminated by defilements, this is called the form aggregate bound to the form realm.
What is the mind sense base bound to the desire realm?
If the mind sense base is contaminated by desire, and eye consciousness up to mind consciousness, this is called the mind sense base bound to the desire realm.
What is the mind sense base bound to the form realm?
If the mind sense base is contaminated by form, and eye consciousness, ear consciousness, body consciousness, and mind consciousness, this is called the mind sense base bound to the form realm.
What is the mind sense base bound to the formless realm?
If the mind sense base is contaminated by the formless, and the mind element and mind consciousness element, this is called the mind sense base bound to the formless realm.
What is the mind sense base unbound?
If the mind sense base is noble and uncontaminated, and the mind element and mind consciousness element, this is called the mind sense base unbound.
What is the dharma sense base bound to the desire realm?

If the elements of dharmas are bound to the desire realm, they are the aggregates of feeling, perception, formation, and consciousness, as well as the unconditioned. The aggregates of form and volition are not included because they are not bound to the desire realm. The aggregates of feeling, perception, and formation are not included because they are not bound to the desire realm. The aggregate of consciousness is not included because it is not bound to the desire realm. The unconditioned is not included because it is not bound to the desire realm. The elements of dharmas that are bound to the desire realm are the aggregates of feeling, perception, formation, and consciousness, as well as the unconditioned.
What are the elements of dharmas bound to the form realm?

If the elements of dharmas are form, contaminated feeling, perception, volition, contact, applied thought, sustained thought, view, wisdom, liberation, non-delusion, faith, joy, vigor, serenity, faith, desire, heedfulness, mindfulness, concentration, equanimity, doubt, afflictions, latent tendencies, birth, old age and death, life, bonds, the attainment of non-perception, contaminated bodily and verbal action that is not manifest, contaminated bodily vigor, and contaminated bodily serenity, they are called the elements of dharmas that are bound to the form realm.
What are the elements of dharmas that are bound to the formless realm?

If the sense-sphere dharmas, the formless dharmas, the contaminated receiving, conceptualization, volition, contact, thought, view, wisdom, liberation, non-delusion, faith-following, mental exertion, mental removal, faith, desire, heedfulness, mindfulness, concentration, mental equanimity, doubt, afflictions, propensities, birth, old age and death, life, bonds, contaminated bodily and verbal precepts without teaching, contaminated bodily exertion, and contaminated bodily removal are in the formless realm, they are called the formless realm-bound sense-sphere dharmas.
What are the sense-sphere dharmas that are unattached?

If the noble, uncontaminated, unconditioned sense-sphere dharmas, the receiving, conceptualization, volition, contact, thought, applied thought, sustained thought, view, wisdom, liberation, non-delusion, faith-following, satisfaction, joy, mental exertion, mental removal, faith, desire, heedfulness, mindfulness, concentration, mental equanimity, attainment of fruits, cessation concentration, right speech, right action, right livelihood, right bodily exertion, and right bodily removal, and the nine unconditioned [dharmas], are called the unattached sense-sphere dharmas.
Among the twelve sense bases, how many are past, how many are future, how many are present, and how many are neither past, future, nor present?
Eleven are either past, future, or present, and one is either past, future, present, or neither past, future, nor present.
Why are eleven either past, future, or present?
The sense bases of the eye up to the sense base of touch are called the eleven that are either past, future, or present.
Why is one either past, future, present, or neither past, future, nor present?
The sense base of mental objects is called the one that is either past, future, present, or neither past, future, nor present.
What is the sense base of the eye that is past?
If the sense base of the eye has already arisen and ceased, that sense base of the eye is called past.
What is the sense base of the eye that is future?
If the eye faculty has not yet arisen or has not yet appeared, it is called the eye faculty of the future.
What is the eye faculty of the present?
If the eye faculty has arisen but not yet ceased, it is called the eye faculty of the present.
Up to the faculty of touch, it is the same.
What is the dharma faculty of the past?
If the dharma faculty has already arisen and ceased, the feelings, perceptions, up to the right abandonment of the body, it is called the dharma faculty of the past.
What is the dharma faculty of the future?
If the dharma faculty has not yet arisen or has not yet appeared, the feelings, perceptions, up to the right abandonment of the body, it is called the dharma faculty of the future.
What is the dharma faculty of the present?
If the dharma faculty has arisen but not yet ceased, the feelings, perceptions, up to the right abandonment of the body, it is called the dharma faculty of the present.
What is the dharma faculty that is neither past, future, nor present?

If the dharma faculty is unconditioned, the cessation due to discrimination, up to the cognition of the sphere of neither-perception-nor-non-perception, it is called the dharma faculty that is neither past, future, nor present.
